chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Plaze E Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Payment plan of $250.00 per month to commence May 15, 2016 and monthly thereafter until paid in full.  Expungment granted only after fine is fully paid.

records.addlTxt: Defendant does not plan to seek postconviction relief.
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Plaze E Anderson in court with attorney Eugene B. Loftin.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reporter:  Magie Brady.
Defendant  is to graduate on June 4; defendant concerned that he might not be able to do so.  PSI is recommending probation.  
PSI received and reviewed.  No additions or corrections by the State.  Defense makes 1 correction.
State's sentencing argument.  Recommends probation.  State will not oppose request for expungment.  Restitution (no request received), but PSI indicates defendant paid $700 to victim.
Defense sentencing argument.  Recommending fine.  Expungment requested.  Defendant plans on attending out of state school in fall.  
Defendant speaks on own behalf.
BTC:  $500 + cc     FTP 90 days RCJ      PPP $250/month, commencing 05/15/16.  Expungment ONLY after fine is paid in full.
